H0.text: Salt and water are what oceans add to make hurricanes so strong, as hurricanes are large, powerful storms that form as they travel over warm ocean waters.

H1.text: Wind and tides are what oceans add to make hurricanes so strong, as hurricanes are large, powerful storms that form while traveling over warm ocean waters.

H2.text: Heat and moisture are what oceans add to make hurricanes so strong, as hurricanes are large, powerful storms that form over warm ocean waters.

H3.text: Waves and flooding are what oceans add to make hurricanes so strong, because hurricanes are large, powerful storms that form as they travel over warm ocean waters.

A4.text: Heat energy from the ocean acts as the accelerator for tropical cyclones.

A5.text: They derive their energy through the evaporation of water from the ocean surface, which ultimately condenses into clouds and rain when moist air rises and cools to saturation.
